Class Rabbit

java.lang.Object
Animal
Rabbit
public class Rabbit extends Animal
A model of a rabbit. Rabbits age, move, breed, die (from hunger, sickness, age or getting eaten), hunt, get sick and pass on sickness
Version:
2025.03.01
Author:
Jonny Guest and Jason Immanuel

  • Constructor Details

    • Rabbit

      public Rabbit(boolean randomAge, Field field, Location location, javafx.scene.paint.Color col, boolean isMale, String inheritedGene)
      Create a new Rabbit. A rabbit may be created with age zero (a new born) or with a random age.
      Parameters:
      randomAge - If true, the rabbit will have a random age.
      field - The field currently occupied.
      location - The location within the field.
      col - The color of the rabbit.
      isMale - If true, the rabbit is male.
      inheritedGene - If the rabbit has age zero, it will inherite genes.

  • Method Details

    • act

      public void act(List<Animal> newRabbits)
      This is what the Rabbit does most of the time: it hunts for Grass. In the process, it might breed, die of hunger, or die of old age.
      Specified by:
      act in class Animal
      Parameters:
      newRabbits - A list to return newly born rabbits.
      field - The field currently occupied.

    • getSick

      public void getSick()
      Any animal that is not already sick has a random chance of becoming sick.

    • applySickness

      public void applySickness()
      If sick, the animal will loose foodLevel twice as fast as normal.

    • getGene

      public String getGene()
      Returns:
      genes genetic code of current Rabbit.

    • getAge

      public int getAge()
      return age of each individual rabbit.

    • getBirthCount

      public int getBirthCount()
      return the number of births per rabbit
